resources.string: The algorithm keeps track of how many times you\'ve bought the item, as well as how many trips you\'ve made since that item was first added to one of your lists, and calculates how often you buy it using that. As you make more trips and it gathers more data, its accuracy increases.\n
Some items I bought recently are being suggested every time I open the app. What\'s up with that?

That\'s because the app hasn\'t had long enough to learn how often you actually want to buy that item. Generally speaking, you\'ll have to give it three or four weeks for it to learn how frequently it should be suggesting the new item.\n
What are the trash cans for on the shopping list?

That\'s for if you decide you don\'t need that item after all. That way, the predictive algorithm that guesses if you want to buy the item in future weeks won\'t accidentally take into account you buying an item when you actually didn\'t.\n
What if I\'m making a one-time purchase?

If you don\'t want an item to be suggested again, you can do two things to prevent it. First, during your shopping trip, if you hit the trash can by that item instead of the checkbox, then the algorithm will treat it as if you didn\'t buy the item and won\'t include it in the items to suggest. If you accidentally hit the checkbox, you can go to the \"Previously bought items\" section and remove that item from the database.\n
Do old items ever get deleted automatically?

Yes. If you go for more than a certain number of weeks without buying a saved item, the algorithm will assume it was a one-time purchase and will delete it from the database. The default is 6 weeks, but you can modify that in Settings.\n
